meanings.definition: To mix liquids together to form an emulsion.
meanings.sent1: I will emulsify the oil and vinegar to make a salad dressing.
meanings.sent2: The recipe requires you to emulsify the ingredients until smooth.
meanings.sent3: As a magician, I can emulsify water and oil to create a magical potion!
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality seemed to emulsify with the gloomy atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The blender will emulsify the ingredients into a creamy consistency.

meanings.definition: To combine two substances that do not normally mix together.
meanings.sent1: The detergent will emulsify the grease and water in the sink.
meanings.sent2: In cooking, you often need to emulsify oil and egg yolks to make mayonnaise.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment accidentally caused the chemicals to emulsify in a colorful explosion!
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was able to emulsify their differences and create a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to emulsify paint and water for a unique effect on the canvas.
